intro: Elaeocarpus petelotii, commonly known as the Madagascar elaeocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the family Elaeocarpaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its evergreen canopy and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits that are typically yellow or red when mature. Elaeocarpus petelotii is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Its ecological role includes providing food for various wildlife species and supporting local ecosystems.
